{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3741517,"name":"dino","username":"dinoman","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/d6d6ee/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-09-17T20:36:55.267Z","cooked":"

Hello CD, I have a question about shooters from different game years.

For the first example, I’m going to use 971’s shooter with an adjustable hood, but with no additional wheels/rollers on the hood.

_DSC05231367×911 231 KB

What is the reason they don’t use the additional rollers on the hood? What is the purpose of those rollers? In 2020, 254 used a shooter with an adjustable hood, but they also added an additional roller/wheel powered from the main shooter wheel.

Ekran görüntüsü 2025-09-17 233027972×688 275 KB

My question is: what is the purpose of those rollers, and why should I use them when there is a ball-shooting game? I know those years had different game pieces, but I can’t quite put the puzzle together.

There are also many other questions—for example, why did 971 use so much gear reduction to move the hood, but 254 didn’t.

Thanks for the answers in advance!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-09-17T20:36:55.267Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":32,"reads":153,"readers_count":152,"score":260.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":506392,"topic_slug":"question-about-ball-shooters-and-adjustible-hoods","display_username":"dino","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67428,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/question-about-ball-shooters-and-adjustible-hoods/506392/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3741519,"name":"Christopher149","username":"Christopher149","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/838e76/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-09-17T20:43:13.918Z","cooked":"

I don’t have an answer immediately for 2020, but in 2022 the way the Upper Hub was shaped could cause balls with significant spin to roll right back out of the cone, so having upper and lower rollers could reduce spin.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-09-17T20:43:21.624Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":147,"readers_count":146,"score":64.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":506392,"topic_slug":"question-about-ball-shooters-and-adjustible-hoods","display_username":"Christopher149","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14984,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC857 lead mentor / FTC10723+13284+15270 lead mentor"},"post_url":"/t/question-about-ball-shooters-and-adjustible-hoods/506392/2","custom_user_title":"FRC857 lead mentor / FTC10723+13284+15270 lead mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3741521,"name":"pryland","username":"pryland","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pryland/{size}/131208_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-17T20:44:36.880Z","cooked":"

If i recall correctly, the extra roller (powered) is to remove the backspin or even introduce a forward spin. Without the extra roller, the ball will natural exit with a backspin.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-09-17T20:44:36.880Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":145,"readers_count":144,"score":59.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":506392,"topic_slug":"question-about-ball-shooters-and-adjustible-hoods","display_username":"pryland","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25791,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/question-about-ball-shooters-and-adjustible-hoods/506392/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3741525,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-17T20:46:12.776Z","cooked":"
dinoman:

I know those years had different game pieces, but I can’t quite put the puzzle together.

Different game pieces, different goals, and different dynamics of the shot.

2017 was a high speed, spit-as-many-as-possible and hope shooting game. Being off by a little could be disastrous. 2020 was a more controlled cycling game, with a wide variety of angles, but also with a bigger target (and a smaller one inside that, but for our purposes that second one doesn’t really matter).

Typically, the rollers are to adjust the spin of the ball, which due to the Magnus Effect can really affect the trajectory. If you’re firing a laser, you want backspin (2020 shooting at the center of the target for max points); if you’re firing a lob, you may actually want forward or no spin… like 2017’s Boiler target.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-09-17T20:46:12.776Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":140,"readers_count":139,"score":98.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":506392,"topic_slug":"question-about-ball-shooters-and-adjustible-hoods","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"post_url":"/t/question-about-ball-shooters-and-adjustible-hoods/506392/4","custom_user_title":"#westandwithUkraine","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3741531,"name":"Andrew Torrance","username":"Torrance","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/torrance/{size}/152754_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-17T20:58:24.940Z","cooked":"

2020 we had the top wheel because it got us better launch velocity and range without speeding up the main flywheel to crazy speed. There was still a slight speed mismatch to give us some backspin, enough to stabilize shot and flatten it into a laser, but not full backspin.

2022 we had the entire back of the hood with rollers because we wanted nearly no spin on the ball to minimize energy and prevent bounce outs. This is something you only learn if you buy/build a super realistic goal, with all the right metal and plastics and such to learn about things like bounce outs.

dinoman:

There are also many other questions—for example, why did 971 use so much gear reduction to move the hood, but 254 didn’t.

I can’t speak for either of these teams, but I can venture a guess. First of all, 254 did have a very high gear reduction at 310.5:1 (from their technical binder). Secondly, that robot’s hood was actuated using a Falcon 500, which could produce a lot more torque than the 971’s robot MiniCIM (at least it looks like one), so it needed less reduction.
